Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Infestation \In`fes*ta"tion\, n. [L. infestatio: cf. F. infestation.] The act of infesting or state of being infested; molestation; vexation; annoyance. --Bacon. [1913 Webster]
Free from the infestation of enemies. --Donne. [1913 Webster]
infestation n 1: the state of being invaded or overrun by parasites 2: a swarm of insects that attack plants; "a plague of grasshoppers" [syn: {plague}]
